definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: You don't seem very confident about yourself.
At first Ni-Ni complained that the slides were too hot and no fun.
sentences.chinese: 妮子一开始说溜滑梯都太热不好玩。

sentences.english: Is your signification that is my losing a very natural matter for dream Die that Ni son in Chuang?
sentences.chinese: 你的意思是我输给庄梦蝶那妮子是很自然的一件事？

sentences.english: Thin as a rail and delicate enough for the wind to blow away and no spirit at all.
sentences.chinese: 再看媚兰那妮子，瘦得像根棍儿，一点精神也没有。

definition: girl/servant girl/(used deprecatingly, but sometimes also as a term of endearment)
mythological daughter of Fiery Emperor 炎帝[Yan2 di4] who turned into bird Jingwei 精衛|精卫[Jing1 wei4] after drowning
(literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
newly hatched bird/fig. inexperienced person/fig. chick (slighting term for young woman)/bimbo
(Tw) to pretend/to put on a false front/(Taiwanese, Tai-lo pr. [ké-sian])
homophone group (group of homophone characters, in a rhyme book)
